news-item.title: Former Barclays employees in court accused of Libor fixing
news-item.text: Former Barclays Bank employees Jonathan Mathew, 31, Peter Johnson, 58, and Stylianos Contogoulas, 42, in preliminary hearing charged with conspiracy to defraud by conspiring to make false Libor (London Inter Bank Offered Rate) submissions to benefit of the bank. These are the second set of charges brought by the Serious Fraud Office (SFO) in connection with Libor manipulation. Former UBS and Citigroup trader Tom Hayes, 33, and RP Martin Holdings traders Terry Farr, 41, and Andrew Gilmour, 48, appear on trial next year charged with eight counts of conspiracy to defraud Event Start Date: 2014-03-03 Event End Date: 2014-03-03
